meanings.definition: To form or make a path or road by laying down logs or branches side by side.
meanings.sent1: The scouts were corduroying the trail through the forest.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed corduroying through the woods on our hike.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to try corduroying their way to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The river corduroyed its way through the valley, carving a path of its own.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter echoed as they corduroyed through the fallen leaves.

meanings.definition: To travel on a path or road made by laying down logs or branches side by side.
meanings.sent1: After corduroying the path, we walked along it to explore the forest.
meanings.sent2: The adventurers were corduroying through the dense jungle, following the makeshift trail.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to have a picnic while corduroying along the riverbank.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runners were corduroying their way towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The hikers were corduroying up the mountain, enjoying the scenic views along the way.
